Hi Company_E—thanks for the clarity. Per your note, here are 3 concise end-to-end execution examples + timing:

• Led a core workflow rebuild from discovery → launch in ~10 weeks: defined requirements with stakeholders, owned roadmap/scope tradeoffs, coordinated eng/design/ops, and shipped v1 + iterative improvements; outcome: ~18% reduction in cycle time and ~25% fewer support tickets within 6 weeks post-launch.

• Owned a domain-specific initiative (new feature + rollout): built the plan, wrote the spec, set success metrics, drove implementation and GTM enablement; outcome: +12% conversion uplift on the targeted funnel segment and steady adoption to ~30% of active users over the first quarter.

• Took over a struggling project midstream and delivered: re-scoped, re-baselined milestones, implemented weekly execution cadence and risk tracking; outcome: shipped within 4 weeks, unblocked dependent teams, and improved on-time delivery from ~60% to ~90% for the subsequent quarter.

Earliest start: immediately (or within 1–2 weeks if needed for logistics). I’m also open to aligning scope/level/comp to match your current constraints.

If there’s any chance to re-enter consideration this round, I’d like to formally apply again and move quickly on next steps.
